alert.note: Alert for Lenawee; Monroe (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 11 at 5:44PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM EDT FOR MONROE AND NORTHEASTERN LENAWEE COUNTIES... At 541 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Dundee to near Britton, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. At 525 PM EDT, quarter size hail was reported east of Britton. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... Dundee around 545 PM EDT. Ida and Maybee around 550 PM EDT. Petersburg around 600 PM EDT. Monroe around 605 PM EDT. Temperance around 620 PM EDT. Luna Pier around 635 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Newport, Cone, Macon, Estral Beach, Toledo Beach, Erie, Woodland Beach, Stony Point, Ridgeway and Bolles Harbor. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
